title: Superman's S
content:
Jeremy:   
   
The only suggestions that come to my mind are to check the library &/or web under "Superman", "comic books" or "DC Comics"; check DC Comics' website ( [http://dccomics.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803090654/http:/dccomics.com/)); or contact DC Comics directly in New York City. A trip to your local comic book store might be fun and productive, too.   
   
I know that his "S" symbol has evolved considerably since its debut.   
   
Good luck! Sounds like a fun project.   
   
It might be fun to start a thread discussing the impact of comic books (and other vernacular, primitive and bourgois forms of illustration -- and I use those terms respectfully in the artistic sense ![:)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803090654im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) ) on modern typography. Cartooning, grafitti, folk art and craft and the like could all be on-topic....   
   
David
author: anonymous
